definition: (of police, fire brigade etc) to receive a report of an incident
to receive/to answer (the phone)/to meet or welcome sb/to connect/to catch/to join/to extend/to take one's turn on duty/to take over for sb

sentences.english: Receive alarm hind, prefectural public security bureau and department of propaganda of county Party committee undertook checking instantly.
sentences.chinese: 接警後，縣公安局與縣委宣傳部立即進行了覈查。

sentences.english: After Changzhou fire prevention crew west end fire prevention specialty team answers alarm, rushes to the scene rapidly.
sentences.chinese: 常州市消防支隊城西消防專職隊接警後迅速趕到現場。

sentences.english: Yue Square police station after police Jiejing, immediately rushed to the scene promptly control the situation.
sentences.chinese: 嶽坊派出所民警接警後，立即趕到現場及時控制事態。

sentences.english: The 110 command center sent policemen to the site as soon as they received the crime report.
sentences.chinese: 指揮台接警後立刻派民警趕赴出事地點。

definition: to dispatch police to the scene of crime, accident etc
to sound an alarm/to report sth to the police
civil police/PRC police/abbr. for 人民警察
to report a case to the authorities
to be informed of a case/to take a case/to contract for a job (as a freelancer)
to obtain (information from an archive etc)
to cause an accident/to be responsible for an incident/to provoke a disturbance
